accessibilityDescription: Special assistance for members of the public: City staff can arrange for special assistance with some advance notice. If you need special assistance, please call 416-394-8101, TTY 416-398-0889 or e-mail etcc@toronto.ca.

addressList.fullAddress: Dundas Street West & Kipling Avenue Toronto Ontario

backgroundInformationList.description: EY21.6 - Permanent Closure Dundas and Kipling

noticeDescription:
The Council of the City of Toronto proposes to pass a by-law to permanently close portions of public highway lands abutting Dundas Street West and Kipling Avenue, designated as Part 11 and 12 of the R-Plan 66R-30391, City of Toronto (formerly City of Etobicoke).

At its meeting to be held by video conference on January 8, 2021, commencing at 9:30 a.m. or shortly afterwards, will hear in person who wishes to speak to this matter, or by his or her counsel, agent or solicitor.

To obtain additional information, submit comments or address the Etobicoke York Community Council meeting on January 8, 2021, please contact the Etobicoke York Community Council no later than 12:00 noon on January 7, 2021.

Nancy Martins, Administrator

Etobicoke York Community Council

c/o Toronto City Hall

100 Queen Street West

Toronto, ON  M5H 2N2

Telephone: 416-394-8101; Facsimile: 416-392-2980

E-mail: etcc@toronto.ca

Notice to people writing or making a presentation to the Etobicoke York Community Council: The City of Toronto Act, 2006 and the City of Toronto Municipal Code authorize the City of Toronto to collect any personal information in your communication or presentation to City Council or its committees.

The City collects this information to enable it to make informed decisions on the relevant issue(s). If you are submitting letters, faxes, e-mails, presentations or other communications to the City, you should be aware that your name and the fact that you communicated with the City will become part of the public record and will appear on the City’s website. The City will also make your communication and any personal information in it – such as your postal address, telephone number or e-mail address – available to the public, unless you expressly request the City to remove it.

Many Committee, Board and Advisory Body meetings are broadcast live over the internet for the public to view.  If you speak at the meeting you will appear in the video broadcast.  Video broadcasts are archived and continue to be publicly available.  Direct any questions about this collection to the City Clerk's Office at 416-394-8101 or by e-mail at etcc@toronto.ca.

This notice shall also constitute notice to the public of the proposed public highway closures in accordance with the requirements of the Municipal Class Environmental Assessment for Schedule "A+" activities.

signedBy: John D. Elvidge, Interim City Clerk
title: Notice of a Proposal to Pass a By-law to Permanently Close Portions of Public Highway Lands Abutting Dundas Street West and Kipling Avenue
topics: Transportation > Intention to close or alter a lane, road or highway
